The strategic hurdles for France-UK military cooperation
subhead: As London strengthens its ties with Washington and deepens its security relationship with Berlin, the French president's state visit to the United Kingdom highlights the fragile nature of defense collaboration between the two countries.

'Faced with Trump and an out-of-touch Democratic leadership, a left-wing surge is taking hold in the US'
subhead: On June 24, Zohran Mamdani, a member of the Democratic Party's left wing, won the party's nomination for mayor of New York City. While his path to victory will likely be difficult, academic Mathieu Bonzom argues that the rise of the American left is becoming increasingly credible.

headline: European Commission dismisses interpreter over suspected espionage for Moscow
subhead: A translator present during a high-level, closed-door meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in late 2024 was caught taking notes, something that is strictly prohibited in this type of meeting.

headline: Nan Goldin confronts Arles photo festival audience about Gaza war: '75,000 Palestinians have been killed'
subhead: The American photographer and winner of the Women in Motion award took advantage of Tuesday's opening night, alongside writer Edouard Louis, to project images of the Palestinian territory ravaged by the Israeli conflict and call for action.

headline: 'On migration issues, we would like those in power to stick to the numbers, facts and science'
subhead: Another narrative must emerge in the face of hostility towards migrants, which has become an electoral issue, argues French former minister Najat Vallaud-Belkacem, who is now the head of a charity supporting asylum seekers.

Is southern France ready for a surge in wildfires?
subhead: France is bracing for a risky summer. The national weather service has classified the Mediterranean arc at 'high' or 'very high' fire alert. While the country has learned lessons from major blazes in 2022, its firefighting aircraft fleet is aging.

headline: France will lend Bayeux Tapestry to the UK, Macron announces
subhead: While local authorities hailed the decision, conservators warned of the risks of moving such a fragile work across the Channel.

headline: Channel crossings by migrants in small boats are on the rise
subhead: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.
